title: Big boost for Make In India: Dassault ties up with Tata to build Rafale parts
content: Tata Advanced Systems will manufacture Rafale fighter aircraft fuselages in India, marking the first production of these components outside France. This collaboration with Dassault Aviation involves establishing an advanced manufacturing facility in Hyderabad.

title: TMC MP Mahua Moitra marries former BJD MP Pinaki Misra in Germany
content: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has reportedly married Biju Janata Dal leader Pinaki Misra in a private ceremony in Germany. The two-time Lok Sabha member from Krishnanagar, Moitra, has not yet issued a public statement regarding the wedding. Misra is a veteran parliamentarian from Odisha‚Äôs Puri and a senior advocate of the Supreme Court.

title: B'luru stampede case: HC issues notice to govt; next hearing June 10
content: Following the deadly stampede near M Chinnaswamy Stadium during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory celebrations, the Karnataka High Court has registered a suo motu writ petition. The court acknowledged the Advocate General's status report and scheduled the next hearing for June 10.

title: IND Tour of ENG: Suryavanshi reveals plan for IPL, says 'next year, I will work on ... '
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old batting prodigy, aims to elevate his performance for Rajasthan Royals in the upcoming IPL season. Fresh off a record-breaking debut where he smashed the fastest century by an Indian off 35 balls, Suryavanshi is determined to improve further. He also earned the IPL Super Striker award.

title: AI killing jobs: Google AI CEO Hassabis has a tip; If I were a student..
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: Tesla Bull makes fun of Elon Musk: Now attacking all people he helped put in power
content: Tesla bull Ross Gerber criticized Elon Musk on X for attacking those he helped empower, pointing to Musk's political endorsements and stances. Gerber suggests Musk's alignment with figures opposing the EV transition and supporting policies against Tesla's success is detrimental.

title: IND vs ENG: Ponting highlights challenge for captain Gill; says 'won't be easy'
content: Ricky Ponting suggests Shubman Gill, the new Indian Test captain, should consider batting at No. 4 in the upcoming England series to ease the pressure of leadership. Ponting acknowledges Gill's strong white-ball form but notes his Test batting needs refinement.

title: Bengaluru stampede aftermath: Scene strewn with footwear, bent railings
content: A deadly stampede near Chinnaswamy Stadium during RCB's IPL victory celebrations in Bengaluru resulted in 11 fatalities and 75 injuries. The tragedy occurred at Gate No. 7 amidst rumors of free tickets, exacerbated by rain and poor crowd management.

title: Who is Mahua Moitra‚Äôs husband Pinaki Misra? All about four-time MP from Puri
content: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has reportedly married Biju Janata Dal leader Pinaki Misra in a private ceremony in Germany. Misra, a four-time Lok Sabha MP from Puri, Odisha, is also a Senior Advocate practicing in the Supreme Court. He first entered Parliament in 1996 and has served on key committees.

title: War twist: Ukraine‚Äôs drone used my open-source code, says shocked developer
content: ArduPilot, an open-source software initially created for hobbyist drones, has reportedly been used in a Ukrainian attack that destroyed a portion of Russia's strategic bomber fleet. The software's creators expressed surprise at its military application, as it was originally designed for peaceful purposes like search and rescue and autonomous vehicles.

title: 'Lalu's son failed Class 9 yet he wants him to be Bihar's king': Prashant Kishor
content: "We need to learn from Lalu Prasad Yadav how to worry about children. Lalu ji's son did not pass the 9th class, but Lalu Yadav is so worried about his child that he still wants him to become the king of Bihar. When we say this, people say that we complain about him. No! We are praising Lalu Yadav," Kishor said while addressing a public gathering in Bihar's Saran on Wednesday.

title: ‚ÄòHer laptop is still on office table‚Äô: Bengaluru techie dream ends in grief
content: Devi, a devoted RCB fan from Tamil Nadu working in Bengaluru, eagerly sought permission to attend the team's victory parade. Despite missing online ticket availability, she optimistically headed to the stadium. Tragically, her friends received a call from the hospital, marking the last communication and leaving them with the heartbreaking task of informing her parents.

title: Paan Singh Tomar‚Äôs granddaughter booked for assaulting junior engineer in Jhansi
content: Sapna Tomar, granddaughter of the infamous Paan Singh Tomar, has been booked for allegedly assaulting a junior power department engineer in Jhansi. The incident occurred when a team was installing smart meters at her grandfather's house, leading to a physical altercation. A video of the confrontation has surfaced, intensifying public interest due to her family's history.

title: Covid cases in India: Coronavirus cases cross 4,500; Kerala tops chart
content: India reports 4,866 active Covid-19 cases as of June 5, 2025, with Kerala, Delhi, and West Bengal leading the count. Fatalities highlight vulnerability among those with pre-existing conditions. Globally, China, Singapore, Taiwan, and the United States report the highest cases. Citizens are advised to stay vigilant and take necessary precautions.

title: Tears of joy: Kohli's mother gets emotional after RCB‚Äôs win; pictures go viral
content: After an 18-year wait, Virat Kohli finally clinched the IPL trophy as RCB successfully defended their total. Kohli's emotional celebration, shared with Anushka Sharma and fans, highlighted the victory. His sister, Bhawna Kohli, shared heartfelt messages and family photos, celebrating the long-awaited triumph and expressing pride, while remembering their father.

title: Are banks and stock market open or closed on June 6 & 7? Check what's open for Bakrid
content: Eid al-Adha is anticipated to be celebrated in India on June 7, potentially marking a public holiday with closures for schools, colleges, and government offices. Banks will observe closures on June 6 in Thiruvananthapuram and Kochi, with varied operations on June 7 across different cities. Stock markets (NSE & BSE) will remain open, while digital banking services will continue uninterrupted.

title: No Trump worries: Why UAE is a great destination for Indian students
content: In the US today, education policy has become a weapon of ideology. Entry is no longer based on merit but on whether your passport aligns with America‚Äôs current geopolitical mood. In such a scenario, a new contender has quietly risen: the United Arab Emirates.

title: Raincoat & bloodstain: Grim clue found as search for missing bride continues
content: Meghalaya Police discovered a stained 3XL raincoat near Sohra during the search for Sonam Raghuvanshi, whose husband, Raja, was found murdered. Forensic tests are underway to determine if the stains are blood and if the raincoat matches Sonam's.

title: IPL: Sehwag reacts on Kohli winning title; says 'Tendulkar's wait was longer'
content: Virender Sehwag drew parallels between Virat Kohli's IPL trophy wait and Sachin Tendulkar's World Cup pursuit. Kohli's Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) won the IPL, with Kohli's significant contribution ending his 18-year wait. However, celebrations turned tragic as a stampede during the victory parade resulted in 11 deaths and 47 injuries, leaving Kohli and the team devastated.

title: 'RCB should be sued': India WC winner lambasts IPL franchise; B'luru stampede sparks criticism
content: Following Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory, a felicitation ceremony at Chinnaswamy Stadium turned tragic. A stampede outside the stadium resulted in 11 fatalities and several injuries, prompting strong criticism from former cricketer Madan Lal. He condemned the poor planning and crowd management, urging families of the deceased to sue RCB and the government.

title: Communal post case: Influencer Sharmistha gets bail by Calcutta HC
content: The Calcutta High Court granted interim bail to social media influencer Sharmishtha Panoli, arrested for allegedly hurting religious sentiments through an Instagram video. The court instructed the state to provide basic amenities to Panoli while in custody and restrained authorities from filing new FIRs on the same grounds.

title: 18-yr wait ends: Ponting reflects on Kohli's breakdown; says 'that‚Äôs what it means to win IPL'
content: Virat Kohli's emotional reaction after Royal Challengers Bengaluru won the IPL final shows the tournament's importance. Ricky Ponting highlights Kohli's long-awaited victory. Kohli compares the win to his love for Test cricket. He urges young players to respect the traditional format. Ponting supports Kohli's views on Test cricket. He acknowledges the significance of such moments in Kohli's career.

title: Murder inside court lockup: Inmate killed by two others; old animosity suspected
content: Aman, an inmate from Tihar jail number 8, was killed by two fellow prisoners, Jitender and Jaidev, inside the Saket court lockup on Thursday. The assault occurred after all three were brought to court for proceedings. The Delhi police reported that Jitender and Aman had a prior conflict stemming from an assault in 2024, where Aman allegedly attacked Jitender and his brother with a knife.

title: Putin strikes after warning Trump: 5 killed in Ukraine's Pryluky
content: Russian drone attacks struck Ukrainian cities. Pryluky faced an overnight attack, resulting in five deaths, including a child. Six others were wounded. Kharkiv was also hit, leaving seventeen injured, among them children and a pregnant woman. The attacks targeted residential areas. Peace talks between Ukraine and Russia occurred in Istanbul. Russia declined a ceasefire.

title: IND vs ENG: England announce squad for 1st Test; check who made the team
content: England have announced their 14-member squad for the first Test against India, scheduled for June 20, 2025, with Jamie Overton making a comeback. Overton replaces the injured Gus Atkinson, while Jacob Bethell's return adds depth to the batting lineup. Ben Stokes will lead the team, which includes experienced players like Joe Root and Zak Crawley, alongside young talents.

title: How ICE arrested record number of illegal immigrants in a single day?
content: ICE conducted its largest single-day operation, apprehending over 2,200 individuals, many from the Alternative to Detention program, following White House directives to increase enforcement. Lawyers reported ICE used mass text messages to lure ATD participants to early check-ins, resulting in arrests. An ICE spokesperson stated those arrested had final removal orders, a claim disputed by lawyers.

title: Vande Bharat trains for Kashmir: Check full schedule
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla Railway Link on June 6. The launch includes the Chenab and Anji Khad railway bridges. Two new Vande Bharat trains will also be flagged off. Regular Vande Bharat services to Kashmir will commence on June 7, 2025. These trains will initially run from Katra to Srinagar six days a week.

title: Israel recovers bodies of two hostages from Gaza - Judih Weinstein and Gad Haggai
content: Israeli forces announced the recovery of the bodies of Judih Weinstein, 70, and Gad Haggai, 72, hostages taken during the October 7 Hamas attack. The couple, from Kibbutz Nir Oz, were killed during the attack, their bodies found in Khan Younis. The October 7 attack resulted in approximately 1,200 deaths and 251 hostages.

title: B'luru Stampede: Krunal Pandya breaks silence, says victory parade 'meant to share joy'
content: A stampede outside Bengaluru's M. Chinnaswamy Stadium resulted in multiple fatalities during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's victory parade. The team had just won their first IPL title. Cricketer Krunal Pandya and Virat Kohli expressed their condolences. The parade was cut short. Initial reports suggest overcrowding and poor crowd control caused the tragedy.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Deputy CM DK Shivakumar breaks down; watch video
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar, in tears, addressed the media following a stampede near Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium during RCB victory celebrations, resulting in 11 deaths and over 70 injuries. He apologized for the tragedy, acknowledging the government underestimated the crowd size.

title: 'Allu Arjun was arrested, why not Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar?' asks BJP's Sambit Patra
content: Following a stampede at Royal Challengers Bangalore's victory march in Bengaluru, which resulted in 11 deaths, the BJP has fiercely criticized the Congress-led Karnataka government. BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra held CM Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar responsible, demanding their resignation. Patra questioned the event's organization, crowd control, and continuation of celebrations amidst the tragedy, calling it a 'government-manufactured tragedy'.

title: JAC Class 12th Arts result released: Overall pass rate at 95.62%
content: The Jharkhand Academic Council (JAC) announced the Class 12 Arts stream results for 2025 on June 5th. The overall pass percentage reached 95.62%, with 2,17,273 students passing out of 2,27,222 who appeared. Students can access their results on jac.jharkhand.gov.in and DigiLocker using their roll code and number. Khunti district achieved the highest pass percentage at 99.53%.

title: 'Gang-raped 8 times in front of mother': BJP functionary arrested with boyfriend
content: A BJP functionary in Haridwar and her boyfriend were arrested for allegedly orchestrating the gang-rape of her 13-year-old daughter. The abuse, which occurred multiple times between January and March, involved forcing the girl to consume alcohol and threatening her to silence. The survivor disclosed the ordeal to her father, leading to the arrests and ongoing search for a third suspect.

title: 'No need to ask us to stop': Tharoor on Rahul's 'Narender, surrender' jibe at PM
content: Shashi Tharoor is currently leading a delegation in the US. He responds to Rahul Gandhi's controversial remark. Tharoor shifts focus to Indian unity. He highlights the delegation's diversity. Tharoor dismisses concerns about criticism overshadowing the mission. He reiterates India's stance on US mediation in India-Pakistan tensions. Rahul Gandhi alleged Narendra Modi acted on Trump's cue.

title: NEET aspirant shoots himself after checking answer key in Bhopal
content: Nikhil Pratap Rathore, an 18-year-old NEET aspirant with a stellar academic record, tragically died by suicide after reviewing the answer key and finding his score lower than anticipated. Overwhelmed by stress, he used his father's licensed pistol to take his own life, leaving his family and friends in shock. Police have seized the weapon and are investigating all possible angles.

title: What is Autopen? Signature device used by Biden to sign pardons
content: Donald Trump has ignited controversy over President Biden's alleged use of an autopen for signing pardons, deeming it a "political scandal." Autopens, mechanical devices replicating signatures, have been used by past presidents for routine documents. Trump questions the validity of pardons signed with an autopen, particularly those for his son Hunter, siblings, Gen. Milley, Dr.

title: What went wrong? Bengaluru stampede through survivors‚Äô lens
content: A tragic stampede at Bengaluru's M. Chinnaswamy Stadium claimed eleven lives and injured 75 during a celebration for Royal Challengers Bengaluru‚Äôs (RCB) anticipated IPL victory. Overcrowding near stadium entrances triggered panic, leading to the deadly rush. Eyewitnesses described a chaotic scene with collapsed barricades, police intervention, and desperate attempts to escape.

title: 'We don‚Äôt want them': What prompted Trump‚Äôs travel ban on 12 nations
content: President Trump has announced a sweeping travel ban impacting nationals from over a dozen countries, citing security concerns and inadequate vetting procedures. The restrictions, implemented through a presidential proclamation, introduce a tiered system of barriers affecting work, study, tourism, and relocation. Exemptions are granted for athletes participating in the 2026 FIFA World Cup and the 2028 Olympic Games.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Virat, Anushka return to Mumbai; tragedy overshadows RCB celebration
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma were seen in Mumbai after RCB's IPL victory celebration, which was overshadowed by a tragic stampede in Bengaluru. The stampede, occurring during the team's homecoming, resulted in 11 fatalities and numerous injuries. Kohli expressed his grief, and the RCB franchise conveyed condolences, turning a moment of triumph into one of mourning.

title: Bengaluru stampede: ‚ÄòPushed from all sides, then fell'; eyewitness recounts horror
content: A celebratory parade for Royal Challengers Bengaluru turned tragic as a massive crowd surge led to chaos and fatalities. Among the victims were a young girl, a tech worker, and a student, all caught in the crush. Families are now grappling with the sudden loss of their loved ones, highlighting the devastating consequences of the uncontrolled event.

title: Bengaluru stampede: From joy to horror; timeline of tragedy that claimed 11 lives
content: Celebrations turned tragic in Bengaluru. A stampede occurred outside Chinnaswamy Stadium. Eleven people died and many were injured. The incident happened during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's victory parade. Poor planning and lack of crowd control led to the disaster. Officials cited political pressure and communication breakdown. The state government has ordered an inquiry and announced compensation.

title: 'Bilawal Bhutto's mother was assassinated': Tharoor slams Pak; invokes Clinton's 'vipers' rebuke
content: Shashi Tharoor, leading a parliamentary delegation to the US, strongly criticized Pakistan for its alleged support of terrorism, responding to Pakistan's diplomatic efforts led by Bilawal Bhutto. Tharoor highlighted India's position following 'Operation Sindoor' and the Pahalgam attack, emphasizing the need to counter Pakistani narratives through media engagement and direct outreach.

title: ‚ÄòBorn in Maharashtra, must be named in Marathi‚Äô: Penguins now part of language row
content: A controversy surrounds the naming of penguin chicks at Mumbai's Byculla Zoo. BJP leaders are demanding Marathi names for the newborns. They oppose the current English names like Noddy, Tom, and Pingu. The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has not responded to appeals. The chicks hatched in March to parents Popeye, Olive, Daisy and Donald.

title: Oilers win a thriller: Grades for both teams, what to watch in Game 2
content: Edmonton strikes first in the 2025 Stanley Cup Final. Here's how it happened and what comes next Friday.

title: Draisaitl's OT goal caps Oilers' rally in Game 1 win
content: Leon Draisaitl scored on a power play in overtime after the Oilers erased a multigoal deficit to beat the defending champion Panthers 4-3 in Game 1 of their Stanley Cup Final rematch.

title: Atwood pounces on IBB try to lift Texas at WCWS
content: Reese Atwood hit a go-ahead, two-run single for Texas when Texas Tech ace NiJaree Canady was trying to walk her, and the Longhorns beat the Red Raiders 2-1 in Game 1 of the Women's College World Series finals Wednesday night.

title: Manfred 'paid attention' to Trump support of Rose
content: Rob Manfred took President Donald Trump's support of Pete Rose into account when the MLB commissioner decided that permanent bans by the sport ended with death.

title: Twins' Lopez out 8-12 weeks with shoulder injury
content: Twins right-hander Pablo Lopez is expected to miss 8-12 weeks with a Grade 2 strain in his right shoulder.

title: Ronaldo fires Portugal past Germany to NL final
content: Cristiano Ronaldo scored the winner as Portugal fought back to beat Germany 2-1 on Wednesday and reach the Nations League final.

title: Red Sox win on shortest walk-off HR on record
content: Ceddanne Rafaela curled a 308-foot home run around the Pesky Pole in the bottom of the ninth inning on Wednesday, and the Red Sox rallied after trailing four different times to beat the Angels 11-9.

title: Michigan offers 2027 safety Charles Woodson Jr.
content: Michigan has extended an offer to class of 2027 safety Charles Woodson Jr., opening its recruitment of the son of Pro Football Hall of Famer and Wolverines 1997 Heisman Trophy winner Charles Woodson.

title: Source: No investigation into Storm assistant
content: The WNBA followed up on an allegation that a Storm assistant coach cursed at an Aces player after the teams' game Sunday, but no investigation was launched, a source said.

title: üèÄ Five Knicks questions after firing Thibodeau
content: NBA insiders examine why the Knicks parted ways with Thibodeau and which coaching candidates could be right for New York.

content: The Thunder and Pacers can trace their superstars and their cores back to trades involving the nine-time All-Star wing.

content: It's that time again: with the UEFA Champions League final behind us and the 2024-25 season officially over, it's time to rank the top 100 players in the world of men's soccer right now. Welcome to the FC 100.

title: Is Novak Djokovic a real contender for the French Open title?
content: He defeated No. 3 Zverev in the quarterfinals -- but can Djokovic continue this level? In his way stands Sinner, and likely Alcaraz too.

content: Which NBA coaching jobs are available? Which situations are the most appealing? We're breaking down each vacancy.

content: Kirk Cousins, Trey Hendrickson and Jalen Ramsey could all be traded soon. We crafted potential offers -- and picked the best deals.

content: Who gained most from moving to a new organization over the past few months? Let's evaluate 15 additions.

title: Power Rankings: Dream ride four-game winning streak to move up in Week 3 edition
content: Las Vegas, Washington and Chicago join Atlanta as risers as the league begins Commissioner's Cup play.

title: 'I'm not na√Øve': Hugh Freeze knows Auburn needs to start winning soon
content: The Tigers have scored recruiting and portal wins of late -- now they have to deliver where it matters most.

title: U.S. visa uncertainties put college rosters in a bind
content: College coaches and international athletes are stuck in an unnerving limbo, saying they're unsure how to plan for recent changes in U.S. student visa policy that could potentially wreak havoc on their rosters this year.

title: Report: Brailsford to scale back Man United role
content: Manchester United's football operations are undergoing yet more change with Dave Brailsford scaling back his role, a source told The Associated Press.

title: USMNT's Steffen (knee) set to miss Gold Cup
content: Zack Steffen injured a knee and became the second goalkeeper dropped from the United States' training camp ahead of the Concacaf Gold Cup.

title: Ancelotti: Brazil need Vini to replicate Madrid form
content: Brazil must help striker Vinicius Jr rediscover the form he has displayed at Real Madrid, new national team coach Carlo Ancelotti said on Wednesday.

title: Mexico's Lozano, Mart√≠n left off Gold Cup team
content: Mexico will be without Hirving Lozano and Henry Mart√≠n for upcoming friendlies vs. Switzerland and Turkey, and the duo will also miss the Concacaf Gold Cup due to hamstring injuries.

title: Inzaghi named Al Hilal boss after Inter Milan exit
content: Simone Inzaghi has been named as Al Hilal's new head coach on a two-year contract, the Saudi Pro League club confirmed Wednesday.

title: Delap joins Chelsea from Ipswich in $40.6m deal
content: Chelsea have bolstered their forward line with the signing of 22-year-old striker Liam Delap from Ipswich Town.

title: Finland mistakenly call up retired 51-year-old
content: Finland women's national team manager has apologised for mistakenly calling up a long-retired 51-year-old for this week's game against Serbia.

title: Stand aside, Messi and Ronaldo: Yamal and Dou√© are coming for you
content: Champions Leagues, World Cups, Ballons d'Or ... get ready for PSG's D√©sir√© Dou√© and Barcelona's Lamine Yamal to become this generation's Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo.

title: Can underdog Julianna Pe√±a pull off another title-fight shocker?
content: Pe√±a enters her UFC 316 co-main event versus Kayla Harrison with long odds for the fourth straight fight.

content: As we prepare for Game 1 of the NBA Finals, we take a look back at the iconic images that defined these playoffs.

content: Tristan H. Cockcroft weighs in on if trading Aaron Judge is feasible... and offers five examples of what return value might even look like.

content: Arike Ogunbowale, Rhyne Howard and Ariel Atkins are some of the biggest movers in this week's fantasy women's basketball rankings.

content: Bayern Munich are preparing offers for Liverpool striker Cody Gakpo and AC Milan winger Rafael Le√£o. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Odds, post positions for the Belmont Stakes
content: Preakness winner Journalism and Kentucky Derby winner Sovereignty have the best odds in the eight-horse field for Saturday's Belmont Stakes.

title: EC goes digital: Poll results, statistics to be made public faster
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: The 20 rookies you should draft in fantasy football
content: the focus is on redraft formats in 10-team PPR leagues . the top 20 rookies are ranked, along with the rounds they should be targeted . it's never too early to start planning for the fantasy season . we are less than 100 days from opening night in Philly .

title: Video: CCTV Captures Indore Couple Before They Went Missing In Meghalaya
content: As the mystery surrounding the disappearance of an Indore couple in Meghalaya deepens, footage from a CCTV at a hotel where they were staying has emerged. The blurry video shows Raja Raghuvanshi and his newly-wedded wife Sonam

title: "Waited 4 Hours To File Case": 15-Year-Old Bengaluru Stampede Victim's Family
content: The family of Divyanshi, a 15-year-old girl who died in the stampede outside Chinnaswamy stadium, Bengaluru, on Wednesday evening, said they had to wait nearly four hours before an FIR could be filed.

title: "Entire State Was Watching. We Are Very Sorry": DK Shivakumar On Stampede Deaths
content: Underlining that he can't express the pain that "we are suffering" over the deaths in a crowd crush outside a Bengaluru stadium as tens of thousands turned up to cheer RCB's win the IPL), said Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar.

title: NTPC Launches 6th Edition Of Girl Empowerment Mission
content: NTPC Limited, India's largest power utility, has launched the 6th edition of its flagship Corporate Social Responsibility programme, Girl Empowerment Mission (GEM-2025).

title: 'Will Find Out If Tragedy Could Have Been Avoided': High Court On Stampede
content: Taking note of the stampede in Bengaluru during the celebrations of RCB's victory in the IPL, the Karnataka High Court has issued notice to the state government and sought a status report.

title: "Pak Issued A Frustrated Statement After Our Malaysia Visit": Salman Khurshid
content: Congress leader Salman Khurshid on Thursday said his patriotism for India and his party exists in equal measure, days after he slammed his critics, including his colleagues, over his remarks perceived to favour the Centre.

title: Accused Strangled By 2 Prisoners Inside Delhi Court's Lock-up
content: A man who was under trial was strangled by two prisoners inside the lock-up of the Saket District Court in Delhi over a past rivalry. The victim, Aman, was taken to the hospital but was declared dead.

title: Putin, Trump Discussed India-Pak Conflict During Phone Call: Kremlin Aide
content: The recent conflict between India and Pakistan was among the issues discussed during a phone call between Russian President Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump, according to a Kremlin aide.

title: World Bank Lifts Lending Freeze Over Uganda Anti-LGBTQ Law
content: The World Bank is lifting a freeze on lending to Uganda it put in place in response to a 2023 law criminalising homosexuality, after taking steps to counter discrimination, it said Wednesday.

title: Russia Bans British Council, Calls It 'Undesirable Organisation'
content: Russia on Thursday banned the British Council as an "undesirable organisation", as Moscow branded London the architect of global crisis and "instigator of wars".

title: Southwest Pacific Hit By Unprecedented Marine Heat Waves In 2024: United Nations
content: Unprecedented heat waves in the Southwest Pacific affected more than 10% of the global ocean surface in 2024, damaging coral reefs and putting the region's last remaining tropical glacier at risk of extinction, the UN's weather body said on Thursday.

title: Caste, Not Class, Will Be Counted In 2027 Population Census: Sources
content: Caste, and not class, will be taken into consideration during the exhaustive count of the population of the country that will be held in 2026-2027, sources said on Thursday.

title: Apple Loses Bid To Pause App Store Reform Order In Epic Games Case
content: Apple has failed to persuade a U.S. appeals court to pause key parts of a federal judge's order requiring the iPhone maker to immediately open its lucrative App Store to more competition.

title: Senior Police Officer Also Among Injured In Bengaluru Stampede, Hospitalised
content: A senior police officer was among the dozens of people who were injured in a stampede in Bengaluru on Wednesday.

title: Suzuki Motor Halts Swift Production Amid China's Rare Earth Curb: Sources
content: Suzuki Motor had suspended production of its Swift car due to China's rare earth restrictions, two sources familiar with the matter said, becoming the first Japanese automaker to be affected by the export curb.

title: 3 Teenagers, Youngest 14, All Under 40: The Victims Of Bengaluru Stampede
content: All the victims of the stampede tragedy at Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy stadium are under 40, with a 13-year-old being the youngest.

title: Russian Commanders Blamed For Ukraine Drone Attack On Bomber Fleet
content: Russian military analysts are hunting for scapegoats after Ukraine stunned Moscow with weekend drone attacks that destroyed a number of strategic bomber planes, weakening a key component of Russia's nuclear arsenal.

title: Russia Working On Creating Drones That Go Undercover. Here's How They Work
content: Russia launched its largest single drone attack of the war against Ukraine's cities on June 1. The Ukrainian Air Force reported that they faced 472 unmanned one-way attack (OWA) drones overnight.

title: Britain's Prince Harry Explored Changing Surname To Spencer: Report
content: Britain's Prince Harry and his wife Meghan explored the idea of changing their family name to Spencer amid months of delays in their two children receiving British passports, the Guardian newspaper reported on Wednesday.

title: Blockbuster semifinal at the French Open: Will Swiatek or Sabalenka win?
content: aryna Sabalenka and Iga Swiatek face off in the semifinals at the french open on friday . the two have played 12 times, with the pair leading 8-4 overall and 5-1 on clay . femail's samir khan is the world's no. 1 for the first time since the semis .

title: Expert picks for Thunder-Pacers
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder and Indiana Pacers are the last two teams left standing . the Pacers won the series in five games, four of which featured 30-plus point outings from NBA MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander . this is the Thunder's second finals appearance, and it would be their first as the Oklahoma city Thunder .

title: Dave Roberts jokingly gives Shohei Ohtani remote-controlled car for his daughter
content: Dave Roberts and his wife bought a pink remote-controlled electronic Porsche for Ohtani's daughter . the two often share jokes and that this gift is a "little bit of a joke" but a sincere one . "this is going to be your daughter's first car," he says .

title: Don't hesitate to get Harper and Chisholm back into lineups
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . fantasy managers return Bryce Harper to their lineups after missing five games due to being plunked in the elbow by a pitch .

title: Betting interest on Fever games dips by half after Caitlin Clark injury
content: the amount wagered on the Fever's two games last week at Caesars Sportsbook was half as much as the team's first four games of the season . caitlin Clark suffered a quad strain . the team attracted more than 90% of the money-line bets in its first three games .

title: 'Narender surrendered to Adani, China': Congress ups ante with fresh jibe at PM
content: Many of "Mr A's" international deals were struck soon after Narendra Modi's official visits to certain countries or after heads of government visited India, Congress leader Ajoy Kumar claimed

title: Tamil Nadu notifies Greater Flamingo Sanctuary at Dhanushkodi

title: Bengaluru stampede: A sea of cheers drowned out by wailing sirens
content: For fans of RCB in Bengaluru, an 18-year wait to celebrate the sweet triumph of their favourite team turned into a bitter tragedy as a crowd surge led to a stampede on June 4, 2025. This is The Hindu‚Äôs complete coverage of the mishap and its aftermath.

content: The High Court, while granting interim bail to Ms. Panoli, said ‚Äúat this point there is no need of custodial interrogation‚Äù

title: Five Kamal Haasan films that courted controversies
content: What sets the latest controversy apart is that, unlike past instances where the objections were over the film‚Äôs content or title, this time, the row has nothing to do with the movie itself.

title: Assam flood situation grim, 7 lakh affected

title: Road to the MCWS: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results

title: Chewing tobacco increases¬†oral¬†cancer¬†risk by over 19 times in elderly people, study says

title: Surely he's aware Pahalgam terrorists still not brought to justice: Congress on PM's J&K visit

And according to some reports that have not been denied, these very terrorists were also involved in the terror attacks in Poonch in Dec 2023 and in Gagangir and Gulmarg in Oct 2024

title: World Environment Day | Ceiling fans are used almost everyday; their power consumption can be cut by half by switching to BLDC tech
content: A BLDC fan ‚Äî which runs on Direct Current ‚Äî consumes less energy. Similarly, a conventional tube light of 40 Watt consumes 0.4 kWh. And, a LED Batten of 20Watt consumes 0.2 kWh, according to the Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE).¬†
